pull.title: Implement OP_CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY
pull.body: This pull request forks from #29198 and only includes the implementation of OP_CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY, its tests (except the functional ones), and standardization of bare OP_CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY locking scripts.

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/29280).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| Concept ACK | [moonsettler](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29280#issuecomment-1900407815) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#30406](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30406) (refactor: modernize-use-equals-default by maflcko)
* [#30352](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30352) (policy: Add PayToAnchor(P2A), `OP_TRUE <0x4e73>` as a standard output script for spending by instagibbs)
* [#29843](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29843) (policy: Allow non-standard scripts with -acceptnonstdtxn=1 (test nets only) by ajtowns)
* [#29270](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29270) (Implement OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK(VERIFY) by reardencode)
* [#29269](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29269) (Add OP_INTERNALKEY for Tapscript by reardencode)
* [#29247](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29247) (Reenable OP_CAT by 0xBEEFCAF3)
* [#29221](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29221) (Implement 64 bit arithmetic op codes in the Script interpreter by Christewart)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Lgtm.  It's the simplest and least controversial and has an extremely broad use case set (not perfect for anything but useful for everything).   No need to bikeshed if it's the best.   It's useful and we need more useful things.

commit of the target branch.

> Closing for now, given #29198 was closed.

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29198 was closed because some reviewers preferred separate pull request for each opcode as it would make it easier to review, test etc.

Related question in a meeting: https://bitcoincore.reviews/bitcoin-inquisition-45#l-112

Related comments: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29198#issuecomment-1889817551
